resources.string: If the status bar clock get stuck enable this. WARNING: Do not depend on this to fix the alarm clock. NOTE: Experimental for now.

The In-Call Audio Service runs in the background and when you are on a call. It resets the volume to workaround the low-in-call volume problem. It also detects if you switch to speaker phone and resets the volume for that stream as well.
The BT Tether workaround detects when your connected to a Tethering "server" and runs dhcp on the bt-pan interface and also runs dnsmasq for you automatically; effectively fixing bluetooth tethering.

I am not sure what benefits this has but this allows you to disable the secondary cpu. It is possible that this may save battery life. Note: I have noticed that disabling it sometimes causes the min and max scaling frequency to both be set at 1000 mhz???(Experimental)
Low Memory Killer - Not Killable Processes: allows you to set a white list of processes in the LMK. LMK will not kill these processes when more memory is needed unless it is absolutely neccessary.
Auto logcat enables automatic dumping of the log to a file in the root of the sdcard. Does not clean up after itself. Should probably keep this off unless I ask you to turn it on.
Auto kmsg enables automatic dumping of the kernel log to a file in the root of the sdcard. Does not clean up after itself. Should probably keep this off unless I ask you to turn it on.
Auto ril log enables automatic dumping of the Radio log to a file in the root of the sdcard. Does not clean up after itself. Should probably keep this off unless I ask you to turn it on.
